messages.title: A hard-working Lib Dem MP...
messages.content: Local campaigner Bridget Fox has a strong track record of fighting to protect Islington's vital NHS services.

messages.title: Doctors and nurses. Not wasteful Government IT projects.
messages.content: We believe the Government should scrap the wasteful £12bn health IT project and spend the money improving our NHS.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut Labour’s waste, oppose wasteful NHS IT projects, and reallocate funds to frontline services.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet claims that 'The Conservatives can't win here', suggesting strategic voting for the Lib Dems to avoid a Labour victory.

issues.health: Labour's NHS IT project is criticized for its £12 billion expenditure without completion, advocating for funds to be used on frontline services instead.

leaflet.personalStatement: As your new MP, I'll fight for real change. I want to give Islington an MP who says what they think and does what they say.

quotes.text: Every year, Labour's bureaucrats spend hundreds of millions of pounds on unnecessary red tape.

images.caption: Bridget Fox will fight to protect our local NHS
2005 General Election Result showing Labour, Lib Dem, and Conservative votes in Islington & Finsbury.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet mentions several times the local impact Bridget Fox has and contrasts that with Labour's alleged neglect. The leaflet suggests a tactical voting situation, highlighting how Conservatives can't win in the area and how Lib Dems are the viable opposition to Labour.
